Division fireworks
 




The Tigers' Kenny Rogers allows two runs through 5 1/3 innings.  (AP)



    

    

      
      Detroit gets redemption vs. Cleveland, 4th of July style. Kenny Rogers 
      (3-0) and the Tigers top their AL Central rivals 6-4 to even the series, 
      leading to Thursday's 
      clash between Justin Verlander and C.C. Sabathia.
    

  
Full story Related Links:• Fourth of July: History | Scoreboard | Reports: Indians | Tigers | Photos• Thursday: CLE-DET, 1 p.m. | All-Stars | Rumors | Fantasy |  Weekly


 


 

 





 On confident roll, Venus in Wimbledon world of her own


    

      
      Venus Williams shrugs off delays and Maria Sharapova before her gimpy 
      kid sister Serena is KO'd by Justine Henin. Venus is feeling 
      unbeatable, Art Spander says.
    

  
• Scores | Day 9 | Day 8 | Notes | Nadal takes his rips


 

 





 Mejia: Carlesimo has shot at salvation with SuperSonics


    

      
      Known best for being infamously choked out in Golden State, coach P.J. 
      Carlesimo will have 
      an opportunity in Seattle to finally shed that 'tyrant' label once and 
      for all.
    

  
• Report: P.J. | Ratto | Durant in | Allen out | Lewis, too
